sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: RIGA a large, ſtrong, populous, and rich town of the Ruffian empire, and capital of Livonia. It is a large trading place, and has a very conſiderable for-treſs ; the trade is chiefly in corn, ſkins, leather, and naval ſtores. It was taken by the Ruffians in 17 10, after they had blocked it up a long while, during which the inhabitants were afflicted with the plague. The caſtle is ſquare, and defended by four towers and fix battions ; beſides which, it has a fine arſenal. The Proteſtants have ſtill a handſome college here. It is. ſeated on a large plain on the river Dwina. E. Long. 24. 25. N. Lat. 57. o.
